results.title: The Legend of Jimmy Governor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Looks at the life of a half-caste Aborigine who killed a dozen white people in 1900. He is immortalised in Thomas Keneally’s novel, and Fred Schepisi’s film of the book, The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith. A Big Country filmed Keneally on location and includes interviews with Fred Schepisi and Tommy Lewis, who plays Jimmie Blacksmith.

results.title: DNA: molecule of heredity
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Dr. George Beadle, discoverer of DNA and Nobel prize winner, explains why DNA, a giant molecule of the cell chromosomes, is the basis of growth and reproduction and the mechanism for transporting hereditary specifications from one generation to the next.

results.title: A Land fit for heroes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Examines the harsh reality that lay behind the concept of parcelling out plots of land for soldiers returning from both the first and second world wars. Uses archival footage, interviews and old radio broadcasts. Reporter - Ron Iddon. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mitosis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows a mitosis actually taking place in a living cell. Demonstrates the effects of chemicals and radiation on dividing cells. Discusses the importance of mitosis to the growth and maintenance of an organism. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Kiwis
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, John Sparkes, Janet Bell and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Ernie Leonard, a Maori who had relinquished his traditions and heritage became chief of his tribe at the age of 55. He had been a television compere, later becoming a television producer and Ernie was able to show how he had learnt language and traditions and helped in fostering this knowledge in the young. He now produces a television program in Maori each week called ‘Koha’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Williams, John Sparkes, Janet Bell and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Meiosis: sex cell formation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
This film explains how meiosis, or reduction division occurs in the formation of sex cells. It illustrates the sequence of changes in the parent-cell nucleus which results in the creating of two daughter cells, each having half as many chromosomes as the parent cell. Meiosis also enables plants and animals to produce offspring with a variety of characteristics.

results.title: Dingo country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A fence almost 6,000 miles long stretches from South Australia to Queensland and attempts to separate the dingo from the sheep. The dingoes are vigorously hunted and killed, but the film presents the view that man must learn to acept the dingo.

results.title: Laws of heredity
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows how inheritance is determined in statistically predictable ways. Presents the insights and conclusions about inheritance that were first discovered by Gregor Mendel. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Brush with royalty
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A group of artists from Broken Hill prepare for an exhibition of their work in London. Artists include Pro Hart and Jack Absalom, and all use the countryside around Broken Hill as their source of inspiration. This film is recommended for students in Years 9-12.
